title: State Bicycle Co’s All-New 4130 Trail Hardtail Has 130 mm Travel and a 65º Head Angle!
content:
State Bicycle Co began selling fixed gears and singlespeeds for students and people looking for entry-level bikes to get around town and commute on. Later, it debuted gravel bikes and even a fat bike. Today, the brand has announced its first hardtail mountain bike, dubbed the 4130 Trail.

The 4130 Trail frames come equipped with a trail-ready geometry, a UDH hanger, 29 x 2.6″ or 27.5 by 2.8″ clearance, and a RockShox Psylo Silver RC, all for $1499.99 complete or $495 for the frame.

State Bicycle Co 4130 Trail Quick Hits

  • Affordable – $1499.99 complete or $495 for the frame
  • Two Colors – Patina Gold or West Sunset
  • Four Sizes – XS/S to XL
  • Progressive Trail Geometry – A slack 65° head angle, low-slung top tube, and long front-center ensure stability when the trail gets rowdy, while maintaining playful agility in the corners.
  • Universal Derailleur Hanger(UDH) Compatibility — It is future–proofed for modern drivetrain tech and easier maintenance because you don’t need to stress parts availability.
  • Double-Butted 4130 Chromoly Steel Frame – Tougher than aluminum and smoother than carbon, our double-butted 4130 Chromoly frame absorbs trail chatter and takes a beating without flinching.
  • Internal Dropper Routing – With a 31.6mm seat tube and internal cable routing, upgrading to a dropper post is hassle-free.
  • Threaded Bottom Bracket (73mm BSA) – Reliable, creak-free, and easy to service.
  • More Mounting Points – Triple bottle cage mounts on the downtube because adventure doesn’t come with limits.
  • RockShox Psylo Silver RC – 130mm Travel, 35mm Stanchions: At $1,499.99, you’d typically see a budget fork with spindly stanchions and questionable performance. Not here. The RockShox Psylo Silver RC features 35mm aluminum upper tubes, which enhance steering precision and stiffness when tackling technical descents.
  • SRAM DB4 Brake Upgrade – Upgrade the 4130 Trail’s brakes with the new SRAM DB4. A low-maintenance mineral oil system providing heavy-duty stopping power. Available for a $150 USD upgrade.
